Cucumber/Cucumber with TestNG Integratio.description: Cucumber by itself focuses on BDD and scenario execution, but it relies on a test framework like TestNG for advanced execution control.

Cucumber/Data Tables and Examples.description: Cucumber provides Data Tables and Examples to handle data-driven scenarios.

Cucumber/Introduction.description: Cucumber is a Behavior Driven Development (BDD) framework that helps teams write tests in a human‑readable format while still executing them as automated tests.

Cucumber/Parallel Execution in Cucumber.title: Parallel Execution in Cucumber
Cucumber/Parallel Execution in Cucumber.description: Parallel execution is essential for reducing execution time in large automation suites.

Cucumber/Parameterization and Data Mappi.description: Parameterization allows Cucumber steps to accept dynamic data instead of hardcoded values.

Cucumber/Reporting and Plugins.title: Reporting & Plugins
Cucumber/Reporting and Plugins.description: Reporting is a critical part of Cucumber automation.

Cucumber/Runner Class and Cucumber Optio.title: Runner Class & Cucumber Options
Cucumber/Runner Class and Cucumber Optio.description: The Runner Class is the control center for executing Cucumber tests.

Cucumber/Scenario vs Scenario Outline.title: Scenario vs Scenario Outline
Cucumber/Scenario vs Scenario Outline.description: Understanding the difference between Scenario and Scenario Outline is critical for writing clean, maintainable BDD tests.

Cucumber/Shared State and Scenario Conte.title: Shared State & Scenario Context
Cucumber/Shared State and Scenario Conte.description: In real Cucumber frameworks, steps often need to share data.

Cucumber/Step Definition Basics.title: Step Definition Basics
Cucumber/Step Definition Basics.description: Step definitions are where Gherkin steps are mapped to executable automation code.

Cucumber/Tags and Tag Expressions.title: Tags & Tag Expressions
Cucumber/Tags and Tag Expressions.description: Tags in Cucumber allow you to control which scenarios are executed without changing feature files.

Cucumber/What is BDD.title: What is BDD (Behavior Driven Development)?
Cucumber/What is BDD.description: Behavior Driven Development (BDD) is a development and testing approach that focuses on system behavior from the user’s perspective, rather than technical implementation details.

Cucumber/Writing Good Gherkin Scenarios.title: Writing Good Gherkin Scenarios
Cucumber/Writing Good Gherkin Scenarios.description: Good Gherkin is the heart of successful BDD.

Database/Database Constraints.description: Database Constraints (UNIQUE, NOT NULL, CHECK) – Automation Tester Awareness

Database/Joins.description: SQL Joins – INNER JOIN & LEFT JOIN (Automation Tester Guide)

Database/NULL Handling.title: NULL Handling
Database/NULL Handling.description: SQL NULL Handling (IS NULL / IS NOT NULL) – Automation Tester Guide

Database/Primary and Foreign Key.title: Primary and Foreign Key
Database/Primary and Foreign Key.description: Keys define how data is uniquely identified and related inside a database.

Database/SELECT Basics.title: SELECT Basics
Database/SELECT Basics.description: SQL SELECT Queries – Basics (Automation Tester Guide)

Database/SQL Subqueries.title: SQL Subqueries
Database/SQL Subqueries.description: SQL Subqueries (IN, EXISTS) – Automation Tester Awareness

Database/Types of Databases.title: Types of Databases
Database/Types of Databases.description: Types of Databases (RDBMS vs NoSQL) – Automation Tester Awareness

Docusaurus/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
Docusaurus/congratulations.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

Docusaurus/create-a-blog-post.title: Create a Blog Post
Docusaurus/create-a-blog-post.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

Docusaurus/create-a-document.title: Create a Document
Docusaurus/create-a-document.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

Docusaurus/create-a-page.title: Create a Page
Docusaurus/create-a-page.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

Docusaurus/deploy-your-site.title: Deploy your site
Docusaurus/deploy-your-site.description: Docusaurus is a static-site-generator (also called Jamstack).

Docusaurus/markdown-features.title: Markdown Features
Docusaurus/markdown-features.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

Extent Report/advanced_configuration_and.title: Advanced Configuration & Customization
Extent Report/advanced_configuration_and.description: This section covers controlled customization of Extent Reports used in real-time enterprise projects. The goal is clarity and traceability—not visual overengineering.

Extent Report/ci_cd_integration.title: CI/CD Integration
Extent Report/ci_cd_integration.description: This section explains how Extent Reports is used in real CI/CD pipelines such as Jenkins and GitLab. A report that works locally but fails in CI is considered broken.

Extent Report/common_mistakes_and_anti_p.title: Common Mistakes & Anti-Patterns
Extent Report/common_mistakes_and_anti_p.description: This section documents real mistakes repeatedly seen in production automation frameworks. Avoiding these is as important as knowing the correct implementation.

Extent Report/creenshots_and_media_handl.title: Screenshots & Media Handling
Extent Report/creenshots_and_media_handl.description: Screenshots are non-negotiable in real-time automation projects. This section explains how to capture and attach screenshots correctly so they remain accurate under parallel execution and CI pipelines.

Extent Report/cucumber_bdd_integration.title: Cucumber / BDD Integration
Extent Report/cucumber_bdd_integration.description: This section explains how Extent Reports integrates with Cucumber-based BDD frameworks in real-time projects. The goal is to produce business-readable reports without breaking thread safety or framework discipline.

Extent Report/framework_level_integratio.title: Framework-Level Integration
Extent Report/framework_level_integratio.description: This section explains how Extent Reports fits into a real automation framework. At this level, reporting is no longer a utility—it becomes a stable infrastructure component.

Extent Report/fundamentals_and_architect.title: Fundamentals & Core Architecture
Extent Report/fundamentals_and_architect.description: This section explains how Extent Reports actually works internally and why many implementations fail in real-time projects. Understanding this architecture prevents flaky, incorrect, and untrustworthy reports.

Extent Report/logging_and_status_handlin.title: Logging & Status Handling
Extent Report/logging_and_status_handlin.description: This section explains how to log correctly in Extent Reports so reports remain readable, accurate, and trustworthy in real-time projects. Bad logging practices are one of the biggest reasons reports become noisy and useless.

Extent Report/roadmap_overview.title: Extent Reports – Real‑Time Roadmap (Overview)
Extent Report/roadmap_overview.description: This roadmap is validated against real enterprise automation frameworks using Selenium, TestNG, Cucumber, Jenkins, and GitLab. It focuses on what is actually implemented in production, not demo‑level usage.

Extent Report/setup_and_basic_configurat.title: Setup & Basic Configuration
Extent Report/setup_and_basic_configurat.description: This section shows how to set up Extent Reports correctly so it works reliably in real-time projects, including CI pipelines and parallel execution. Version mismatch and bad initialization are the #1 causes of reporting issues—this avoids both.

Extent Report/test_ng_listener_integrati.title: TestNG Listener Integration
Extent Report/test_ng_listener_integrati.description: This section explains how TestNG listeners orchestrate Extent Reports correctly in real-time automation frameworks. In production projects, listeners—not test classes—own the reporting lifecycle.

Extent Report/thread_safety_and_parallel.title: Thread Safety & Parallel Execution
Extent Report/thread_safety_and_parallel.description: This section is the most critical part of Extent Reports in real-time projects. Without proper thread safety, reports become unreliable under parallel execution—even if tests themselves pass.

Git/Git.title: Git
Git/Git.description: Git is a version control system that lets you track changes in your project, go back to old versions, and collaborate safely with others.

Java For Automation Testers/build-tools-.description: Build Tools & Logging for Automation Testing (CI-Ready Frameworks)

Java For Automation Testers/concurrency-.description: Concurrency for Automation Testing (Parallel Execution Without Chaos)

Java For Automation Testers/core-apis-fo.description: Core Java APIs for Automation Testing (Strings, Arrays, Wrappers)

Java For Automation Testers/design-patte.description: Design Patterns for Automation Frameworks (Making Frameworks Scalable)

Java For Automation Testers/exception-ha.description: Exception Handling for Automation Testing (Making Tests Stable)

Java For Automation Testers/file-io-for-.description: File Handling & I/O for Automation Testing (Configuration & Test Data)

Java For Automation Testers/generics-for.description: Generics for Automation Testing (Making Framework Utilities Safe)

Java For Automation Testers/java8-featur.description: Java 8+ Features for Automation Testing (Cleaner, Safer Code)

Java For Automation Testers/jdbc-for-aut.title: JDBC
Java For Automation Testers/jdbc-for-aut.description: JDBC for Automation Testing (Backend & Database Validation)

Java For Automation Testers/jvm-basics-f.title: JVM Basics
Java For Automation Testers/jvm-basics-f.description: JVM Basics for Automation Testing (Stability, Memory & CI Reliability)

Java For Automation Testers/oop-for-auto.title: OOP
Java For Automation Testers/oop-for-auto.description: OOP for Automation Testing (Why Selenium Needs Structure)

Java For Automation Testers/reflection-a.title: Reflection & Annotations
Java For Automation Testers/reflection-a.description: Reflection & Annotations for Automation Testing (How Frameworks Work Internally)

Java For Automation Testers/testing-fram.title: Testing Framework
Java For Automation Testers/testing-fram.description: Testing Framework Internals for Automation (TestNG / JUnit)

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/agents-scaling-.title: Agents & Scaling – Overview
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/agents-scaling-.description: This section explains how Jenkins executes work at scale using agents.

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/docker-agents.title: Docker Agents
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/docker-agents.description: Docker agents allow Jenkins to run builds inside ephemeral containers.

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/ephemeral-cloud.title: Ephemeral & Cloud Agents
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/ephemeral-cloud.description: Ephemeral agents are short-lived, on-demand agents created dynamically for builds.

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/executors-deep-.title: Executors – Deep Dive
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/executors-deep-.description: Executors define how much parallel work Jenkins can run.

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/kubernetes-agen.title: Kubernetes Agents
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/kubernetes-agen.description: Kubernetes agents allow Jenkins to run builds as ephemeral pods inside a Kubernetes cluster.

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/scaling-strateg.title: Scaling Strategies & Cost Control
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/scaling-strateg.description: This document explains how to scale Jenkins safely and cost‑effectively.

Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/static-agents-a.title: Static Agents & Labels
Jenkins/Agents & Scaling/static-agents-a.description: This document covers static Jenkins agents and label-based scheduling.

Jenkins/Architecture/agent.title: Jenkins Agent (Slave / Node)
Jenkins/Architecture/agent.description: This document explains Jenkins Agents, which are responsible for executing builds and tests.

Jenkins/Architecture/controller.title: Jenkins Controller (Master)
Jenkins/Architecture/controller.description: This document focuses on the Jenkins Controller, its internals, and its role in build orchestration.

Jenkins/Architecture/execution-flow.title: Jenkins Execution Flow
Jenkins/Architecture/execution-flow.description: This document explains the end-to-end lifecycle of a Jenkins build.

Jenkins/Architecture/executors.title: Jenkins Executors
Jenkins/Architecture/executors.description: Executors control how many jobs run in parallel in Jenkins.

Jenkins/Architecture/master-slave-archit.title: Master–Slave Architecture (Controller–Agent)
Jenkins/Architecture/master-slave-archit.description: This document explains the core execution model of Jenkins.

Jenkins/Architecture/overview.title: Jenkins Architecture – Overview
Jenkins/Architecture/overview.description: This section introduces the core architectural concepts of Jenkins.

Jenkins/Architecture/workspace-and-queue.title: Workspace & Queue
Jenkins/Architecture/workspace-and-queue.description: This document explains where Jenkins stores files and why builds wait before execution.

Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/archive-ar.title: archiveArtifacts
Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/archive-ar.description: The archiveArtifacts step is used to persist build outputs after a pipeline finishes.

Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/artifacts-.title: Artifacts & Workspace Management – Overview
Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/artifacts-.description: This section covers how Jenkins handles build outputs and data sharing.

Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/copy-artif.title: Copy Artifacts
Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/copy-artif.description: The Copy Artifacts mechanism allows Jenkins to reuse build outputs across jobs.

Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/fingerprin.title: Fingerprints
Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/fingerprin.description: Fingerprints allow Jenkins to track which build produced or used an artifact.

Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/stash-unst.title: stash & unstash
Jenkins/Artifacts & Workspace/stash-unst.description: stash and unstash are used to share files between stages within the same pipeline.

Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.title: Backup Strategy
Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.description: Backups are the last line of defense for Jenkins.

Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.title: Controller Operations & Maintenance – Overview
Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.description: This section covers day-2 operations of Jenkins controllers.

Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.title: Controller Performance Tuning
Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.description: Controller performance tuning focuses on keeping Jenkins responsive, stable, and predictable

Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.title: Controller Upgrade Strategy
Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.description: Upgrading the Jenkins controller is one of the highest-risk operational tasks.

Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.title: Disaster Recovery
Jenkins/Controller Operations & Maintena.description: Disaster Recovery (DR) focuses on restoring Jenkins after major failures

Standalone Java/Foundations/Control-Flow.description: In Java, control flow means the order in which your program runs instructions. By default, it runs from top to bottom, one line after another. Standalone Java/OOPS/Abstraction.description: In Java, the abstract keyword is used to define classes and methods that are incomplete and meant to be implemented later by subclasses.
